metadata.title: Durham, NC Immigration Lawyers - Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC
metadata.metaDescription: Durham is a vibrant North Carolina city with diverse culture, rich history, and a flourishing community. It’s also known as the “City of Medicine,” with healthcare being a major industry including more than 300 medical and health-related companies and medical practices. It is a wonderful place to live for families, couples, and individuals. If you’re someone who is considering immigrating to the United States to become a legal resident of Durham, or somewhere else, or if you have been injured in an accident that wasn’t your fault, or if you have been accused with a crime, Vasquez Law Firm can help you. We are your top choice for representation! We are dedicated to helping clients reach their ideal resolution, no matter what situation they are in. We have extensive experience in personal injury, worker’s compensation, criminal defense, and family law. You can trust us to stand up for your rights! Call now to schedule a free consultation and allow us to apply our 35+ years of experience to your unique situation.

content.heroSection:
Durham, NC Immigration Lawyers

Achieving the American Dream is a long and often confusing road. Immigrating to the United States is not an easy process – it calls for a lot of paperwork, meeting eligibility requirements, legal procedures, tests, and most of all, time. On top of everything else, language and cultural barriers can make the process even more complicated.

Whether your goals for immigration are to obtain a temporary work visa, to fight deportation, or to become a naturalized citizen, you will need skilled legal assistance to get the best outcome. The Durham immigration lawyers at Vasquez Law Firm are experienced in helping people – particularly families – establish a life in the U.S. Reach out to schedule a free consultation and learn about the variety of issues that we can help you overcome.

Immigration Legal Focuses

Immigration law has many facets, and there are many steps on the journey to naturalized citizenship. Not everyone has the same goals for their immigration journey, and our Durham immigration lawyers are prepared to offer you our skilled assistance in the areas that you need. Our focuses include, but are not limited to:

  • Visas: There are several categories and subcategories of visas. Immigrant visas are for people who intend to live permanently in the U.S. while non-immigrant visas are for people who are staying in the U.S. temporarily. Non-immigrant visas include types for tourism, work, education, and others.
  • Green cards: A green card is an important step in the journey toward full citizenship. When you are issued a green card, you are granted full legal status, meaning that you can legally live and work in the U.S. There are several ways to obtain a green card – for example, being sponsored by a resident family member or employer, or applying for legal asylum.
  • Deportation appeals: Also called “removal proceedings,” deportation is the process by which a foreign national is removed from the U.S. You can be subject to removal proceedings for many reasons, including an expired visa or a criminal conviction. When we learn the unique circumstances surrounding your deportation order, our Durham immigration lawyers can craft a strategy to challenge your removal proceedings.
  • Adjustment of status: If you meet certain criteria and you possess a temporary visa, you can apply for an adjustment of status, which can allow you to obtain a green card.
  • DACA: Signed into law in 2012, Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) provides some level of protection for undocumented children who grew up in the U.S. If you meet certain residency criteria, you can apply for DACA relief, which will protect you from deportation and allow you to obtain a driver’s license and other forms of documentation.
  • Criminal defense: If you have a green card or a visa and you are convicted of a crime, you are at risk of losing these documents and being subject to removal proceedings. If you are accused of a crime, you need to work with one of the Vasquez Law Firm immigration lawyers who understands criminal defense in order to defend your residency here in the U.S.
  • Naturalization: If you have obtained a green card, you are eligible for the naturalization process, which means that you will be a legal citizen of the United States! The process for naturalization is complex, so it requires the help of an experienced immigration lawyer.

And more! The Durham immigration lawyers at Vasquez Law Firm have experience across many fields of immigration law, and we are confident in our ability to assist you with your unique and specific needs. 

Trust Our Durham Immigration Lawyers With Your Immigration Legal Needs

Immigration is a complex process, but with the help of Vasquez Law Firm, you can rest assured that it will be as smooth and simple as possible. We offer bilingual services so that you can feel confident you are being understood. We’ll even take care of the tedious paperwork for you! If you have a concern about the legalities surrounding immigration, we want to hear from you–reach out to schedule a free consultation and learn how we can streamline the process for you. 

Practice Areas

  • Durham, NC Immigration Lawyers

mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

[object Object]

## Serving Charlotte and Surrounding Areas
Vasquez Law Firm proudly serves clients throughout Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and the greater North Carolina area. With offices conveniently located in Charlotte, we're here to help with all your legal needs.


## Why Choose Vasquez Law Firm?
- **Experienced Attorneys**: Over 20 years of combined legal experience
- **Bilingual Services**: We speak English and Spanish
- **Free Consultation**: Call 1-844-YO-PELEO today
- **Proven Results**: Hundreds of satisfied clients
- **24/7 Availability**: We're here when you need us
